page.title: 03GENERAL MANAGEMENT , RHUM
page.content: Because of unique attributes as an outdoor lab, priority of use is given to research/education over recreation indicated by the 200 scientific papers written on the Reserve. Some 4-5000 people,from day-trippers to university groups and PhD.students, visit Rhum annually. There are 6 permanent staff, including Chief Warden, Craftsmen and Estate Workers,supported by additional seasonal staff. Much assistance is gained from voluntary help. Logistical support is provided by vehicles such as forestry plough,landrovers,tractors flit-boat,etc... Around 30 people, including the teacher & families make up the population. Accommodation consists of staff homes,Castle,bothies & campsite. Domestic stock comprises 40 Highland cattle and 20 Rhum ponies, the latter providing support for the deer cull. A nursery provides trees.
